Doc: Physically settled leg of a physically settled electricity transaction.

Source.Contents:
/#
   Physically settled leg of a physically settled electricity transaction.
 #/
record FpML5.recordkeeping.ElectricityPhysicalLeg {
  # A reference to the party responsible for making the payments defined by this structure.
  payerPartyReference : FpML5.recordkeeping.PartyReference

  # A reference to the account responsible for making the payments defined by this structure.
  payerAccountReference : FpML5.recordkeeping.AccountReference?

  # A reference to the party that receives the payments corresponding to this structure.
  receiverPartyReference : FpML5.recordkeeping.PartyReference?

  # A reference to the account that receives the payments corresponding to this structure.
  receiverAccountReference : FpML5.recordkeeping.AccountReference?

  # The different options for specifying the Delivery or Supply Periods. Unless the quantity or price is to vary periodically during the trade or physical delivery occurs on a periodic basis, periodsSchedule should be used and set to 1T.
  deliveryPeriods : FpML5.recordkeeping.CommodityDeliveryPeriods?

  # The specification of the Settlement Periods in which the electricity will be delivered. The Settlement Periods will apply from and including the Effective Date up to and including the Termination Date. If more than one settlementPeriods element is present this indicates multiple ranges of Settlement Periods apply to the entire trade - for example off-peak weekdays and all day weekends. Settlement Period ranges should not overlap.
  settlementPeriods : FpML5.recordkeeping.SettlementPeriods

  # The specification of the Settlement Periods in which the electricity will be delivered for a "shaped" trade i.e. where different Settlement Period ranges will apply to different periods of the trade.
  settlementPeriodsSchedule : FpML5.recordkeeping.SettlementPeriodsSchedule?

  # LoadType is a summary of the full description of the settlement periods with respect to the region. Used for describing Electricity delivery schedules (e.g. Base, Peak, Off-Peak, Custom).
  loadType : string?

  # The specification of the electricity to be delivered.
  electricity : FpML5.recordkeeping.ElectricityProduct

  # The physical delivery conditions for the transaction.
  deliveryConditions : FpML5.recordkeeping.ElectricityDelivery

  # The different options for specifying the quantity.
  deliveryQuantity : FpML5.recordkeeping.ElectricityPhysicalQuantity

  id : string?

}

payerPartyReference.Doc: A reference to the party responsible for making the payments defined by this structure.
payerPartyReference.Name: payerPartyReference

payerAccountReference.Doc: A reference to the account responsible for making the payments defined by this structure.
payerAccountReference.Name: payerAccountReference

receiverPartyReference.Doc: A reference to the party that receives the payments corresponding to this structure.
receiverPartyReference.Name: receiverPartyReference

receiverAccountReference.Doc: A reference to the account that receives the payments corresponding to this structure.
receiverAccountReference.Name: receiverAccountReference

deliveryPeriods.Name: deliveryPeriods

settlementPeriods.Doc: The specification of the Settlement Periods in which the electricity will be delivered. The Settlement Periods will apply from and including the Effective Date up to and including the Termination Date. If more than one settlementPeriods element is present this indicates multiple ranges of Settlement Periods apply to the entire trade - for example off-peak weekdays and all day weekends. Settlement Period ranges should not overlap.
settlementPeriods.Name: settlementPeriods

settlementPeriodsSchedule.Doc: The specification of the Settlement Periods in which the electricity will be delivered for a "shaped" trade i.e. where different Settlement Period ranges will apply to different periods of the trade.
settlementPeriodsSchedule.Name: settlementPeriodsSchedule

loadType.Doc: LoadType is a summary of the full description of the settlement periods with respect to the region. Used for describing Electricity delivery schedules (e.g. Base, Peak, Off-Peak, Custom).
loadType.Name: loadType

electricity.Doc: The specification of the electricity to be delivered.
electricity.Name: electricity

deliveryConditions.Doc: The physical delivery conditions for the transaction.
deliveryConditions.Name: deliveryConditions

deliveryQuantity.Doc: The different options for specifying the quantity.
deliveryQuantity.Name: deliveryQuantity
